title: Can't sync in `light` mode
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.8.10`
OS & Version: OSX 10.12.6

via Docker-compose:

```
version: '3'
services:
 
  # ethereum node
  ethereum:
    container_name: app-ethereum
    image: ethereum/client-go:v1.8.10
    ports:
      - "8545:8545" # HTTP RPC
      - "30303:30303"
      - "30303:30303/udp"
    volumes:
      - ./ethereum-data/.ethereum:/root/.ethereum
      - ./ethereum-data/keystore:/root/.ethereum/testnet/keystore:ro
    restart: always
    command: --verbosity 4 -rpc --ipcdisable --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpccorsdomain "*" --syncmode "light" --cache=512 --testnet
```

#### Expected behaviour

Syncs

#### Actual behaviour

Not syncing, reporting errors.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

`docker-compose up ethereum`

#### Backtrace

````
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:48] invalid neighbour (178.169.230.235) from 13366ed4ef4492d9@159.65.92.57:10101: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:49] invalid neighbour (109.157.40.45) from 646831bed6b7d5fa@193.70.41.43:30303: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:49] invalid neighbour (103.51.153.10) from 0d7c32571a4b101a@94.130.8.110:30303: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:51] invalid neighbour (121.8.227.29) from 0b4eadfedaa3a16f@37.139.18.135:46969: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:51] invalid neighbour (35.227.149.33) from 3ef2ca42fee185b6@35.185.120.42:30303: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:53] invalid neighbour (212.20.44.70) from 1c7f5636c7346c90@212.71.246.158:30303: low port 
app-ethereum | DEBUG[07-06|10:53:53] invalid neighbour (91.147.220.117) from bb2a1423adb293ae@116.126.141.113:30303: low port 
````

BTW sometimes it can sync, 1 peer found:
````
$geth attach http://127.0.0.1:8545
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.8.11-stable/linux-amd64/go1.10.3
 modules: admin:1.0 eth:1.0 net:1.0 rpc:1.0 web3:1.0

> net.peerCount
1
> admin.peers
[{
    caps: ["eth/62", "eth/63", "les/1", "les/2"],
    id: "053d2f57829e5785d10697fa6c5333e4d98cc564dbadd87805fd4fedeb09cbcb642306e3a73bd4191b27f821fb442fcf964317d6a520b29651e7dd09d1beb0ec",
    name: "Geth/v1.8.11-stable-dea1ce05/linux-amd64/go1.10",
    network: {
      inbound: false,
      localAddress: "172.19.0.3:42918",
      remoteAddress: "79.98.29.154:30303",
      static: true,
      trusted: false
    },
    protocols: {
      les: {
        difficulty: 8775099689016871,
        head: "9d21333c2162390d8939a8cd37a2614f161969fa3a3cab1b928d8e385e28a3fe",
        version: 2
      }
    }
}]
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 3535726,
  highestBlock: 3584781,
  knownStates: 0,
  pulledStates: 0,
  startingBlock: 3480430
}

````

I'm not sure if adding `- "30301:30301/udp"` to ports affected this.
It looks like it can connect to the same version client only (1.8.11)

hmm, i was able to connect from client 1.8.10 to 1.8.11 peer too:
````
$geth attach http://127.0.0.1:8545
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.8.10-stable/linux-amd64/go1.10.2
 modules: admin:1.0 eth:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 web3:1.0

> net.listening
true
> net.peerCount
1
> admin.peers
[{
    caps: ["eth/62", "eth/63", "les/1", "les/2"],
    id: "053d2f57829e5785d10697fa6c5333e4d98cc564dbadd87805fd4fedeb09cbcb642306e3a73bd4191b27f821fb442fcf964317d6a520b29651e7dd09d1beb0ec",
    name: "Geth/v1.8.11-stable-dea1ce05/linux-amd64/go1.10",
    network: {
      inbound: false,
      localAddress: "172.19.0.3:42978",
      remoteAddress: "79.98.29.154:30303",
      static: true,
      trusted: false
    },
    protocols: {
      les: {
        difficulty: 8775123067518064,
        head: "54f49ef3f42674d0437b720609035dab4ea01caa3624226601cbd597b8f6811f",
        version: 2
      }
    }
}]
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 3233042,
  highestBlock: 3584826,
  knownStates: 0,
  pulledStates: 0,
  startingBlock: 3211263
}
````

same from 1.8.1 client - also connected to 1.8.11 peer:
````
$geth attach http://127.0.0.1:8545
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.8.1-stable/linux-amd64/go1.9.4
 modules: admin:1.0 eth:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 web3:1.0

> net.peerCount
1
> admin.peers
[{
    caps: ["eth/62", "eth/63", "les/1", "les/2"],

    name: "Geth/v1.8.11-stable-dea1ce05/linux-amd64/go1.10",
    network: {
      inbound: false,
      localAddress: "172.19.0.3:43010",
      remoteAddress: "79.98.29.154:30303",
      static: true,
      trusted: false
    },
    protocols: {
      les: {
        difficulty: 8775131626510915,
        head: "b4dc69d353397422bc5486aa809933b1deaa67c5367e9d3599657574e46d1f39",
        version: 2
      }
    }
}]
````

but i was unable to connect from 1.8.12 client to 1.8.11 peer:
```
$geth attach http://127.0.0.1:8545
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.8.12-stable/linux-amd64/go1.10.3
 modules: admin:1.0 eth:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 web3:1.0

> net.peerCount
0
```
can you confirm it should be able to connect to 1.8.x peers only or it's a bug? is 1 peer expected value for --testnet (looks strange low number)
even on main net i was able to find only 1 light-compatible peer! That's really strange

This affects ethereum java library too (bug report):
https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/627

Any solution/fix/workaround?

I've had "invalid neighbour" messages since 1.8.10. Symptoms were that geth virtually did nothing at all (console displayed no activity when not in debug mode), sometimes, geth started syncing for a while, then stopped and would not work for days. Firewall virtual server forwarding was not configured. Please try configuring firewall to allow 30303 tcp&udp forwarding to your local machine, then set local machine's firewall to allow 30303 for geth process (tcp & udp, both directions). Then add -nat=none to geth args. Works for me since (geth 1.8.14). Full geth arguments:
-syncmode light --debug -nat=none --verbosity 4 console 2>"c:\geth\log.txt"

It looks like there are virtually no peers supporting light clients on the mainnet. We tried light sync on different servers in different parts of the world. We always find just the same 1-2 peers:
```
$ geth attach 
> admin.peers.length
1
> admin.peers.forEach(function(value){
    console.log("####\n" +
                        "# Enode: " +  value.enode + "\n" +
                        "# IP addr: " + value.network.remoteAddress + "\n" + 
                        "# Client: " + value.name +  "\n")
})
####

# IP addr: 94.176.237.140:30303
# Client: Geth/v1.9.5-stable-a1c09b93/linux-amd64/go1.11.5

```

```
> admin.peers.length

```
Geth 1.9.5. Servers don't have NAT and are facing the internet directly.

It’s always impossible to start syncing with the `--syncmode light` parameter only.
However, after I added `--maxpeers 200`, the synchronization started after a a period of time.

My final parameters are like this for reference:
```
geth --syncmode light --rpc --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --ws --wsaddr 0.0.0.0 --verbosity 4 -maxpeers 200 --nousb
```
It's better now, more light servers around, but generally it's a tragedy of the commons. Hopefully this'll improve with incentivised light servers.
